meanings.definition: A person who attributes or assigns responsibility or blame to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The imputer in the office always points fingers at others for mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was seen as the imputer when it came to disciplining students.
meanings.sent3: The imputer at the party blamed the broken vase on the cat's tail.
meanings.sent4: She was like an imputer of guilt, always finding someone to blame.
meanings.sent5: The imputer's role in the play was to assign fault to the characters.

meanings.definition: To attribute or ascribe (something) to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He tends to imputer his own failures onto others instead of taking responsibility.
meanings.sent2: The detective tried to imputer the crime to the suspect based on evidence.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly imputered her messy room to the invisible cleaning fairy.
meanings.sent4: The artist imputered emotions to the colors on the canvas, creating a powerful piece.
meanings.sent5: The scientist imputered the success of the experiment to precise measurements.
